Text.Value: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.
Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. What are you doing here?

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 2 HAV - FIRST TIME MEETING WITH KARLACH

Text.Value: I have business in this cursed wasteland, if you can believe it.
Let's think about it first - we don't want to do something we can't take back.
Who needs a heart when you've got one of these to keep you warm. Thank you, Zariel.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Hand tapping metal infernal engine on chest

Text.Value: I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for you to - well, touch people.
Thanks - I'll definitely be back.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 3 LOW - FIRST TIME MEETING WITH KARLACH

Text.Value: Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.

EditorData.logicalname: AOM - ACT 2 - HAV -  HAS MET - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: Before you run off into the belly of the beast, there's something I need to tell you.
No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.
Absolutely - let's see what his upgrade involves.
I... I don't know how this is going to end for you. For any of us, really. But I know I'd be dead without you, several times over.
There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

EditorData.logicalname: AOM - ACT 3 - LOW - HAS MET IN DEN - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: The good news, obviously!
I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for you to -
Fuck yes, we will.
I haven't stopped trying, but all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -

EditorData.NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

Text.Value: There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 3 - LOW - HAS MET IN DEN - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: There you are. I was wondering where you'd run off to.

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 3 - LOW - COM - HAS MET IN DEN - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: Let's move!
This can wait - we have more important things to handle first.
Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. So c'mon, let's get this show on the road - we need to find that iron!
I was hoping you'd say that.
That's all I needed to hear. I'll be back with some infernal iron.
I'll come back when I've got the iron and my team in tow. They'll definitely want to see what happens!
It's simply too hot to exist here in the material plane. Unless you return to Avernus - for good - this thing is going to blow. Sooner rather than later.
You must have a similar story. Unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you.
I thought I smelled infernal iron.
Off the anvil, into the forge. We'll find them - hopefully.
Shout if you need anything else.
Best I've had in years. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.
Off the anvil, into the forge. We'll find them - hopefully.
Give us the good news.
Argh - at least let me show you where to look. I'm not sure the infernal iron will still be there, but I can show you a few places of interest.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustrated with Karlach cause she's not listening, but does still want to help her.

Text.Value: Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 2 - HAV -  COM - HAS MET - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: I could try to sort you out, but I'll need some infernal iron and a lot of luck.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (OOM - ACT 3 - LOW - HAS MET IN DEN - HAS UPGRADE)

Text.Value: No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose - hey... do I smell infernal iron?
Let's let Dammon speak. This sounds important.
Never mind. I'm glad you're set up for the long run, in any case. One of us should be.
I should be thanking you. I'd love to get my hands on something other than pauper's ore...
Thank you for saving my life. But I have to ask... what are you doing here?
Karlach. You're looking well.
Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.
I've got the iron right here. Let's make this happen.
Leave.
Best I've had in years. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.
Heavens above - there you are, Karlach! I was so hoping you'd come find me. I saw you you lot in Last Light, but didn't want to distract you from the fight against Ketheric.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 3 LOW - HAS MET IN DEN - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Text.Value: Best I've had in years. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.
Gimme the good news.
Pure tiefling ingenuity. That engine of yours is like nothing I've ever encountered - hard to change, but possible to... enhance.
Go on, give him the iron. Let's make this happen.
Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.
Karlach, believe me, this isn't something you should -
I sensed some iron in the area when we arrived here - but I'm not sure if it's still there, now that we've been holed up. But I'll show you where I'd look.
Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Choices]*DUPE*[Dammon][Karlach] Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Dammon approaches Karlach and leans his ear toward her chest, trying to listen to her heart. We hear its fire burning, cogs grinding, etc. After a moment, Dammon jerks away, feeling the heat of her.

EditorData.VFXTags: [EG] Slight smoke off Dammons face as he gets burnt by Karlachs body

Text.Value: Yeah, sure, but first - fix me. Please.
Leave.
Thanks to you, I'm feeling well.
Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus.
Let's hear the bad news.
Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.

EditorData.logicalname: AOM - ACT 2 HAV - HAS MET IN DEN - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Text.Value: Take a look at what I've got on offer, while you're here. Might be you find something useful to you.
Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. We've got the iron - let's do this thing!

EditorData.logicalname: Party has the material for the heart.

Text.Value: Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.
I haven't stopped trying to think of something that could help your engine last it out, by the way. But so far, all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -

EditorData.NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

Text.Value: Who needs a heart when you've got one of these to keep you warm. Thank you, Zariel.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm. Lightly pounds chest on 'one of these'.

Text.Value: - touch people?!
Did you misplace it? I'll be here if you find it again - just shout.
Karlach. You're looking well.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (AOM - ACT 3 - LOW - HAS MET IN LOW - HAS UPGRADE)

Text.Value: That's terrible. If we can help them, we will.
Exactly.
As a matter of fact, I think I might. I've sensed some in the area. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.
Same to you. Though unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you. Infernal engine?
Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.
Exactly.

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 2 - HAV - COM - HAS MET IN HAV - HAS UPGRADE
AOM - ACT 2 - HAV - HAS MET IN HAV - HAS UPGRADE
AOM - ACT 3 - LOW - HAS MET IN HAV - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: Glad to see you're so well set-up here.
Karlach. You're looking well.
Dammon! Thank the gods. I've been looking for you everywhere.
Before you run off into the belly of the beast, there's something I need to tell you.
Prick.
You think wrong! Thanks Dammon; I'll be back.
Same thing as you, I reckon. Trying to stay out of the shadows.
Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.
Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. I'll be back as soon as I've got the goods in tow.
Thank you for saving us - again.
I don't enjoy saying this, Karlach, but there's no two ways about it: your engine is going to blow, and I can't fix it. I'm not sure anyone can.
Yes. Yes we should. I feel like I'm about to blow in more ways than one.
- touch people?!
Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.
Never mind. Glad you're all right in any case. Nice forge you've got here.
It can wait and so can you.
It's the best situation I've had in years, honestly. Mistress of the house lets me operate from here for a fair price. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't happy.
Can I see your wares?
Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. What are you doing here?

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 2 HAV - FIRST TIME MEETING WITH KARLACH

Text.Value: We have business in the city. Same as you, by the looks of things. Nice forge you have here.
Forget warm - you're burning up. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
In fact, I've got a piece on me now. Let's do this.
Prick.
Hey soldier - we've got some infernal iron already. Let's give it to him, hey?
Ew, no! Good news, please, my good man.
Could I see your wares?
Karlach! I thought you'd be in the city by now. We were ambushed by cultists. Half of us were captured, the other half ran here.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 2 - HAV -  HAS MET IN DEN - HAS UPGRADE

Text.Value: Well... two things. Good news and bad news.
Can I see your wares?
Couldn't be happier to hear that.
Would be a lot better if you'd find a way to fix this engine, Dammon.
Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus. Not too different from my own story.
I never wanted to live forever. I just want to live good.
Any idea where we can find some infernal iron?
Same thing as you, I reckon. Trying to stay out of the shadows.
Any idea where I can score some infernal iron?
Karlach, did you hear what Dammon said? Your engine is going to explode - soon.
Well... two things. Good news and bad news.
Could we see your wares?
I can still help with that upgrade, if you've found some infernal iron.
Thanks, Karlach. I... I don't know how this is going to end for you. For any of us, really. But I know I'd be dead without you, several times over.
Wouldn't leave you folks behind - not ever.
Good news is my favourite kind.
Leave.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 2 -HAV - HAS MET IN HAV - HAS UPGRADE)

Text.Value: I was hoping you'd say that.
Well - all right. But don't be long, Karlach.
Forget warm - you're burning up. Might be burning out a piston ring - or leaking oil. Mind if I take a listen?
Dammon! You're here!
Nothing is more important than this. Not to me.
Certainly.
Head off before he can say another word.
We have business in the city. Same as you, by the looks of things. Nice forge you have here.
Heavens above - there you are, Karlach! I was so hoping you'd come find me.

EditorData.logicalname: AOM - ACT 3 LOW - HAS MET IN DEN - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Text.Value: Wouldn't leave you folks behind - not ever.
Barely. Many of us weren't so lucky. We were ambushed by cultists. Those of us who didn't fall in the fight were dragged off - a few of us fled and made it here.
But - but still, you can give me something that'll let me touch again, right? Safely?
Same to you. Though unless my senses deceive me, you brought a bit of the Hells back with you. Infernal engine?
I could try to sort you out, but I'll need some infernal iron and a lot of luck.
No surprise you'd find me renting a room off the local diabolist I suppose. But you've found me now, and there's something I need to tell you.
|DEBUG donate UI test.|
Karlach, believe me, this isn't something you should -
Well... two things. Good news and bad news.
I can still help with that upgrade, if you've found some infernal iron.
Thank you for all you've done for us - for me. But I have to ask... what are you doing here?
Yes, but -
Fall in line. We have higher priorities.
Sure. Meantime, if you need to stock up, everything I have is available.
Hang on - I think you'll want to hear the bad news, too.
As a matter of fact, I think I might. I've sensed some in the area. It has a pull to it - absolutely magnetic, once you know what you're looking for. I can show you where I'd look.
Please do. I've been dying to find an infernal mechanic.

Text.Value: Looking for help with this hot tin tub I call my heart.
Which do you want to hear first, Karlach?
We'll look for some iron.
Infernal iron, eh? I can swing that. Will come back with command in tow and take it from there. Thanks, Dammon - you don't know what this means.
I only need one more piece of infernal iron to craft an insulating chamber that could make it possible for Karlach to -

Text.Value: Hm - might be you've misplaced it? I'll be here when it turns up again.

Dammon! You're here!

Text.Value: Never mind. I'm glad you're set up for the long run, in any case. One of us should be.
Fine. Well, go on then.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little irritated. She doesn't want bad news.

Text.Value: Good. Someone should be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Warmly with ab ittersweet twist. She's glad Dammon is happy but sorry he can't fix her.

Text.Value: Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.
Heavens above - there you are, Karlach! I was so hoping you'd come find me. I saw you you lot in Last Light, but didn't want to distract you from the fight against Ketheric.

Text.Value: Never mind. Glad you're all right in any case. Nice forge you've got here.
Of course - any time.
That's all I need to know. Do it. Please.
Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. Karlach, right? Without you lot, I'd've been toast twice over. First in the druid's grove, then at Last Light Inn.

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 3 LOW - FIRST TIME MEETING WITH KARLACH

Text.Value: Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 2 HAV - HAS MET IN DEN - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Text.Value: Hold on - I know you. The weaponsmith, right? Drafted into the Blood War when your city was swallowed by Avernus. Not too different from my own story.
Ah, it'll keep. I have infernal iron to find.

Aha - thought I sensed an infernal. Karlach, right? Without you lot, I'd've been toast twice over. First in the druid's grove, then at Last Light Inn.

Text.Value: Thank you for saving us - again.
I'm not sure. Should we be tampering with an infernal machine?
In another life, I would've liked to... well. It doesn't matter now. Good luck, Karlach. And thank you. Again.
Phew! You really are burning up. Whoever put that engine together tried to house metallurgised demono-valves inside a ra-gnax alloy casement. Very risky.
I haven't stopped trying, but all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -

Text.Value: Leave.
Give us the good news.
That's terrible. If we can help them, we will.
I'm sure!
Any idea where I should look for the last piece?
I haven't stopped trying, but all roads lead to a dead end. Sorry - I didn't mean -

EditorData.NodeContext: CAtching himself after saying 'dead end' since Karlach is going to die.

Text.Value: Well done making it out alive.
Yes we do. We absolutely do. I need help, and I'm going to get it. Got it?
I sensed some in the area when we arrived here - but I'm not sure if it's still there, now that we've been holed up. But I'll show you where I'd look.
That's amazing! How did you figure it out?
Karlach! I thought you'd got lost in the shadows. Glad to see you made it through all right.

EditorData.logicalname: ACT 2 HAV - HAS MET IN DEN - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Text.Value: Would be a lot better if you'd find a way to fix this engine, Dammon.

EditorData.NodeContext: Good natured but sincere longing for a solution

Text.Value: Good. Someone should be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Warmly with ab ittersweet twist. She's glad Dammon is happy but sorry he can't fix her.

Text.Value: I love good news.
Oh my gods. It's really happening. It's been so long. Just a sec - let me find my pals. I'll be right back!

EditorData.logicalname: Party has the material for the heart.

Text.Value: Leave.
Gods, I'm glad to see you again. There's something I have to tell you.
Barely. Many of us weren't so lucky. We were ambushed by cultists. Those of us who didn't fall in the fight were dragged off - a few of us fled and made it here.
Thought I sensed an infernal around here. I wanted to introduce myself after you helped us in the druid's grove, but I didn't get the chance.

EditorData.logicalname: AOM - ACT 2 HAV - FIRST TIME MEETING WITH KARLACH

Text.Value: If you're sure, then let's do it.
Gotta run!
Dammon! Thank the gods. I've been looking for you everywhere.
There's little I don't believe any more. For example... is that infernal iron I smell?

EditorData.logicalname: OOM - ACT 3 LOW - HAS MET IN HAV - DOES NOT HAVE UPGRADE

Synopsis: Players find Dammon in HAV or LOW for the first or second time in the game with Karlach in your party. He will say that he knows a way to upgrade Karlach for the first or second time, depending on how her origin story evolved.
